title: Firefox 120.0.1
content:
Ever since the automatic update to Firefox 120 my multi-row bookmarks are not working properly. The slightest movement of a bookmark on the first row will instantly flip it down to the end of the 2nd row, and freeze all the bookmarks. I have to restart Firefox is Safe Mode to move the bookmark back where it belongs. If I drag in a new bookmark the two bookmark rows also freeze. Plus they freeze if a bookmark gets slightly jiggled but stays in place. Again, I'll have to restart in safe mode to put things back in order.

Am I the only one experiencing this?

Thanks, BH

title: Firefox Not Allowing for 1password Yubikey Authentication
content:
Hello,

I've had this issue where in order to get the 1password extension to work, you have to login to your account using the firefox browser. During that authentication process, after successful credentials are entered, the web page asks to "Plug in your security key and activate now". However, there is no prompt within the Firefox browser to indicate that firefox is identifying that the browser needs the key. Typically, in the past I've gotten a pop up that's from firefox that says somethign to the effect of "plug in your security key and touch". However, this time it does not occur.

I've gone to 1Password Support, Yubikey Support, and both have told me its nothing wrong with their product, but instead my firefox configuration. I know its not an issue with my hardware key based on various troubleshooting methods - firstly the key appears with `lsusb`, I also am able to use the security key on this same device when using Chrome. We also validated it's not exclusively a 1password issue as I don't get the prompt in firefox when using another website ( https://demo.yubico.com/webauthn-technical/registration)

Below are my webauthn configs: ``` security.webauth.webauthn true security.webauth.webauthn_enable_softtoken false security.webauth.webauthn_enable_usbtoken true security.webauth.webauthn_testing_allow_direct_attestation false security.webauthn.ctap2 true security.webauthn.webauthn_enable_android_fido2.residentkey false ```

I've also toggled the `webauthn_enable_softtoken` on, but no luck. I also po

I'm on version 120.0 of Firefox. Firefox is not installed via snap, and I validated that all the firefox folders & files were owned by root. There also no apparmor or any interference from other apps blocking it from working.

At a loss for what to do, so any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!
creator: mozilla.corned775

title: Lost History
content: I didn't let my computer set long enough after starting up. When I hit Firefox I thought it was starting up wrong and hit the wrong button twice and it crashed and lost ALL my saved tabs. I rely on lots of tabs for my research and now it's all gone. Use to I could go back 2 or 3 months in history and find the link I needed, now you have changed all of that and now anything that's over a month old you wipe out most of the history links. And WORSE of all you can't back up history anymore, when you try it goes to bookmarks instead. You have cost me weeks and weeks of data lost and some I may never find again, why are you doing that to us?? I have been with Firefox from the beginning and now you have set me back for months. IF I ever find another platform that's as good or better than Firefox I gone from here. Do you understand that I had over 50 special tabs saved for research that I can't retrieve now??? Do you understand just how freaking PISSED off I am right now??? OR maybe I will get with Trump and others later and try and start another platform that better than Firefox.

title: Bookmarks, Log In Passwords and other essential security features Exposed
content:
Hi Support,

I have always been struggling with the idea of syncing two devices, that is main and secondary devices, and that when logged out of the secondary device, user details such as passwords, booksmarks and other important things are left bare on that browser or secondary device.

It is my believe that, after completing whatever task that led users to sync both devices, the moment the user logs out on the secondary computer, or any of the computers, the passwords, bookmarks, history and other essential details should not display again on such computer or browser anymore but apparently thats not the case with Mozilla Firefox browser.

Kindly look into that and work on it....THE SECURITY AND SAFETY OF THE USER IS LEFT WIDE OPEN!!!

Any ideas?

creator: phazir50

title: Synced, or not?
content:
I restarted my computer after a crash related to Nvidia drivers on my desktop, and came back to a confusing situation on Firefox. I suspect that it is a Windows issue, but I don't have any leads or proof. For context first:

- I use Firefox on both my desktop and my laptop. - I do NOT use sync. Both are kept separate as my laptop is strictly for work. - I am on Windows 10, and use the same Microsoft login for both the laptop and desktop. - I do NOT have any desktop syncing between the laptop and desktop through Windows (that I know of). OneDrive is enabled, but Firefox is stored locally on both devices.

Currently, I have these symptoms and outcomes:

- Firefox settings have been reset. (Light mode, search engine preference, etc.) - Plugins are all gone, EXCEPT for UBlock Origin. It is a plugin I have on both my laptop and desktop, but on both devices I have other unique plugins as well. - History is (almost) all gone. There are a few items from my laptop's recent (last couple of days) history, but not everything. Trying "restore previous session" brings up one tab that was open on my laptop, but not everything. - Downloads history has items from several days ago which I downloaded on my desktop, but not anything more recent. - Bookmarks are all gone.

Finally, to my questions: - What happened? - Can I restore my desktop Firefox to its previous self? - If I don't have any manual saves of my Firefox setup, am I out of luck? - How can I prevent this from happening again?
creator: nottenounce

title: Accessing Youtube.com causes immediate unlogged tab crash
content:
Hey,

I've been having an odd issue with Firefox where tabs where I attempt to access youtube.com will immediately crash. This issue first arose when I attempted to log in to Youtube, and had never occurred before. When I did that login, the tab crashed, and I have been unable to access the website since (100% crash rate).

Basic details: The website does not visually load at all. However, the URL bar icons for the website do briefly appear prior to tab crash. (Autoplay button, etc). The crash is never reported in about:crashes.

I've tried the following tests, unsuccessfully: - Logging out of all Google accounts separately - Disabling all extensions - Transferring all of my data to a new computer - Reinstalling Firefox - Rebooting Firefox in troubleshooting mode

This problem does not occur on my Windows machine but occurred on my previous intel-based Mac and now on my current Apple Silicon Mac.

The only success I have had is in creating an entirely new Firefox profile. However, I would prefer to fix the issue, as I assume that porting all my settings to the new profile would... also probably bring the bug along.

Thanks for reading & any advice is appreciated.
creator: Michael_sdev
